description.value:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of one of the time rifts

Effect The triggering creature takes [[/r 1d6[electricity]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true] save). The overloading arch rolls initiative.

details.description: The Eternity Arch sparks with electricity, releasing bolts of lightning at each of the four largest time rifts.
details.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20] (trained) or @Check[type:arcana|dc:18], @Check[type:nature|dc:18], @Check[type:occultism|dc:18], or @Check[type:religion|dc:18] (trained) to seal each of the four time rifts, @Check[type:crafting|dc:20] (trained) to divert the lightning to another source, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Dispel Magic]{Dispel Magic} (1st level; counteract DC 17) to counteract each time rift. Each attempt requires 2 actions. Skill checks to disable a time rift must attempted from adjacent to the rift.
details.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled time rift. On each of the trap's actions, the Eternity Arch releases a bolt of lightning that activates that rift, dealing [[/r {2d6}[electricity]]]{2d6 electricity damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the time rift (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true] save). It can release a bolt at each active time rift no more than once each turn.

source.value: Pathfinder Society Special #3-99: Fate in the Future
